```{r Inputting data & making sure everything is organized correctly}
rgb_all_ammonium.data <- read.csv("Master_RGB_Spreadsheet_AMMONIUM_Condensed_Red_1_12_23.csv", header=TRUE, sep=",",stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

#getting rid of all the extra data at the bottom-- we only want rows 1:959 OR 1:639 if only looking at exp 2 and 3 (remember we got rid of the outlier!)
rgb_all_ammonium.data  <- rgb_all_ammonium.data[(1:482),]
rgb_all_ammonium.data <- na.omit(rgb_all_ammonium.data)


#Setting everything I need as factors for linear model and stats
rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_species<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_species)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_dose<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_dose)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$food<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$food)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$sym_state<-as.character(rgb_all_ammonium.data$sym_state)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$food_sym_state<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$food_sym_state)

summary(rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp)

#lets check for normality in red_delta
hist(rgb_all_ammonium.data$red_delta)
qqnorm(rgb_all_ammonium.data$red_delta, main = NULL)
# it doesnt look normal, let's log it

#log transformed red delta
rgb_all_ammonium.data$log_red_delta<-log(abs(rgb_all_ammonium.data$red_delta))
hist(rgb_all_ammonium.data$log_red_delta)
#that looks good enough to do stats on

hist(rgb_all_ammonium.data$red_day11)

```


```{r Basic list of subsets}
# all aposymbiotic
all_apo<-subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$sym_state=="A")
# all symbiotic
all_sym<-subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$sym_state=="S")
# all fed
all_fed<-subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$food=="F")
# all starved
all_starved<-subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$food=="S")
# all 20C
all_20<-subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp=="20")
# all 30C
all_30<-subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp=="30")

#without controls
no_controls <- subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_dose!=0)
```




# LINEAR MODELS

```{r getting data ready for lmer}
rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_species<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_species)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_dose<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_dose)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$food<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$food)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$sym_state<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$sym_state)

summary(rgb_all_ammonium.data$sym_state)
```


```{r rgb delta Model selection }
full.model_rgb_ammonium <- lmer(log_red_delta ~  N_species_dose + temp + food + sym_state + N_species_dose*temp + N_species_dose*food + N_species_dose*sym_state + temp*food + temp*sym_state + food*sym_state +  (1|col_num) + (1|exp_num) , data= rgb_all_ammonium.data)
summary(full.model_rgb_ammonium)
print(step.model<- step(full.model_rgb_ammonium))
#Model found:
#log_red_delta ~ N_species_dose + sym_state + (1 | col_num)

mm_rgb_1 <- lmer(log_red_delta ~ N_species_dose + sym_state +(1|col_num) + (1|exp_num) , data= rgb_all_ammonium.data)
summary(mm_rgb_1)




plot_model(mm_rgb_1, type="diag") #data fitness looks decent
r2(mm_rgb_1) #random explains 30%

```

```{r rgb delta Model posthocs}
# ammonium dose posthoc
emm_rgb_N_species_dose=emmeans(mm_rgb_1, specs=pairwise ~ N_species_dose)
summary(emm_rgb_N_species_dose)
 # contrast     estimate    SE  df t.ratio p.value
 # A_0 - A_10    -0.2228 0.158 443  -1.406  0.4964
 # A_0 - A_5     -0.2585 0.158 431  -1.639  0.3576
 # A_0 - A_7.5   -0.5535 0.159 446  -3.490  0.0030 **********
 # A_10 - A_5    -0.0357 0.158 445  -0.226  0.9959
 # A_10 - A_7.5  -0.3307 0.158 438  -2.095  0.1564
 # A_5 - A_7.5   -0.2951 0.158 441  -1.871  0.2422

# Sym state posthoc
emm_rgb_sym_state=emmeans(mm_rgb_1, specs=pairwise ~ sym_state)
summary(emm_rgb_sym_state) #p=0.02

# Sym state by N species dose
emm_rgb_N_species_dose_sym_state=emmeans(mm_rgb_1, specs=pairwise ~ N_species_dose*sym_state)
summary(emm_rgb_N_species_dose_sym_state)
 # contrast          estimate    SE  df t.ratio p.value
 # A_0 A - A_7.5 A    -0.5535 0.159 446  -3.490  0.0123
 # A_0 A - A_7.5 S    -0.8238 0.201 455  -4.098  0.0013
 # A_10 A - A_7.5 S   -0.6010 0.200 460  -3.009  0.0553
 # A_5 A - A_7.5 S    -0.5653 0.199 460  -2.834  0.0892
 # A_0 S - A_7.5 S    -0.5535 0.159 446  -3.490  0.0123

```


```{r Day 11 models}
#Day 11 is normally distributed so let's take a look at its model, since red delta wasnt as informative as we'd like
full.model_red_day11_ammonium <- lmer(red_day11~  N_species_dose + temp + food + sym_state + N_species_dose*temp + N_species_dose*food + N_species_dose*sym_state + temp*food + temp*sym_state + food*sym_state +  (1|col_num) + (1|exp_num) , data= rgb_all_ammonium.data)
summary(full.model_red_day11_ammonium )
print(step.model<- step(full.model_red_day11_ammonium ))


# DAY 11 IS NOT VERY INFORMATIVE
```


```{r Exploratory t tests}
t.test(all_20$log_red_delta, all_30$log_red_delta) #no difference

t.test(all_fed$log_red_delta, all_starved$log_red_delta) #no difference

t.test(all_sym$log_red_delta, all_apo$log_red_delta) #p=0.009
```

```{r Symbiotic State - red_delta}



#ammonium ONLY 
# plot, treatment x axis colored by site data figure
rgb_treatmeans_apovsym <- summarySE(rgb_all_ammonium.data, measurevar=c("red_delta"),groupvars =c("sym_state"), na.rm=TRUE)
gg_rgb_plot_apovsym <- ggplot(rgb_treatmeans_apovsym, aes(x = sym_state, y= c(red_delta), color = sym_state))+
  theme_bw()+
  geom_point(size = 3, position = position_dodge(width=0.3))+
  geom_smooth(aes(group=sym_state), position = position_dodge(width=0.3), size = 0.5, method='lm', se = FALSE)+
 # geom_jitter(aes(), size=1.2, alpha=0.9)+
  geom_line(aes(group = sym_state), size = 0.5, linetype="dashed", position = position_dodge(width=0.3))+
  geom_errorbar(aes(x = sym_state, ymax = red_delta+se, ymin = red_delta-se), width = .2, position = position_dodge(width=0.3)) +
  #scale_color_manual(name = "Treatment",
                    #labels = c("Control 30C Fed","Control 30C Starved","Ammonium High 30C Fed", "Ammonium High 30C Starved","test"),
                    # values = c("orchid1","darkorchid1","royalblue","skyblue","black","gray","brown"))+
 ylab("Change in Red channel value Pre vs. Post-experiment")+
  ggtitle("Change in Red channel value Sym vs. Apo")+
 labs(caption = "data represent mean +/- SEM")+
  scale_x_discrete("Symboitic State", labels=c(A="Aposymbiotic", S="Symbiotic"))+ #relabels the x axis to the values in quotations
    scale_color_manual("Symboitic State", labels=c(A="Aposymbiotic", S="Symbiotic"), values=c("gray", "brown")) #gives you the colors for each point on the graph
gg_rgb_plot_apovsym

# Summarize by temp and N species dose so we can visualize
```

```{r N species dose graphs}
#Make N species dose a factor and give it levels so it will display in this order

#Make everything else a character so they graph nicely 
rgb_all_ammonium.data$treat_ID_full<-as.character(rgb_all_ammonium.data$treat_ID_full)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp <- as.character(rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp)

# Summarize by N_species_dose so we can visualize
sum_N_species_dose_ammonium <- summarySE(rgb_all_ammonium.data, measurevar = "red_delta", groupvars = c("N_species_dose"))
sum_N_species_dose_ammonium$N_species_dose <- factor(sum_N_species_dose_ammonium$N_species_dose, levels=c("A_0", "A_5", "A_7.5","A_10"))

# Visualize
gg_N_species_dose_ammonium<-ggplot(data = sum_N_species_dose_ammonium,
       aes(x = N_species_dose,
           y = red_delta, col=N_species_dose)) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=red_delta-se, ymax=red_delta+se), width=0.1, size = 1) +
    #scale_color_manual(values = c("black", "darkgreen")) +
    ggtitle ("ammonium - Red channel change N Species Dose summary") +
   theme(legend.position="none")+
    labs(x = "\n", 
         y = expression(paste("Change in  Red channel value")), 
         caption = "data represent mean +/- SEM" ) +
      scale_x_discrete("Ammonium dose", labels=c(CNTRL_0="Control", A_5="5uM", A_7.5="7.5uM", A_10="10uM"))+
    scale_color_manual(labels=labels, values=c("blue", "orchid1","blueviolet","purple4"))
gg_N_species_dose_ammonium

# Summarize by N_species_dose at rgb day 11 so we can visualize
sum_N_species_dose_ammonium_day11 <- summarySE(rgb_all_ammonium.data, measurevar = "rgb_avg_day11", groupvars = c("N_species_dose"))
# Visualize
gg_N_species_dose_ammonium_day11<-ggplot(data = sum_N_species_dose_ammonium_day11,
       aes(x = N_species_dose,
           y = rgb_avg_day11, col=N_species_dose)) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=rgb_avg_day11-se, ymax=rgb_avg_day11+se), width=0.1, size = 1) +
    #scale_color_manual(values = c("black", "darkgreen")) +
    ggtitle ("ammonium - N Species Dose summary") +
   theme(legend.position="none")+
    labs(x = "\n", 
         y = expression(paste("Day 11  Red channel value")), 
         caption = "data represent mean +/- SEM" ) +
    scale_x_discrete("ammonium dose", labels=c(CNTRL_0="Control", N_1.5="1.5uM", N_5="5uM", N_18="18uM"))+
    scale_color_manual(labels=labels, values=c("blue", "#9DCE9D","#359C35","darkgreen","black"))
gg_N_species_dose_ammonium_day11

#Jitter day 11 data
gg_N_species_dose_ammonium_day11_jitter<-ggplot(data = rgb_all_ammonium.data,
       aes(x = N_species_dose,
           y = rgb_avg_day11, col=N_species_dose)) +
```
